summary.para: Gets the decoder's current progressive level.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The level always defaults to the highest progressive level. In order to decode a lower progressive level, must first be called.

summary.para: Gets the number of levels of progressive decoding supported by the CODEC.

param.name: pcLevels
param.para: Indicates the number of levels supported by the CODEC.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Users should not use this function to iterate through the progressive levels of a progressive JPEG image. JPEG progressive levels are determined by the image and do not have a fixed level count. Using this method will force the application to wait for all progressive levels to be downloaded before it can return. Instead, applications should use the following code to iterate through the progressive levels of a progressive JPEG image.

summary.para: Specifies the level to retrieve on the next call to .

param.name: nLevel
param.para: Specifies which level to return next. If greater than the total number of levels supported, an error will be returned.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: A call does not have to request every level supported. If a caller requests level 1, without having previously requested level 0, the bits returned by the next call to will include both levels.
If the requested level is invalid, the error returned is WINCODEC_ERR_INVALIDPROGRESSIVELEVEL.

summary.para: Exposes methods for obtaining information about and controlling progressive decoding.

remarks.para: Images can only be progressively decoded if they were progressively encoded. Progressive images automatically start at the highest (best quality) progressive level. The caller must manually set the decoder to a lower progressive level.
E_NOTIMPL is returned if the codec does not support progressive level decoding.
